entries.name: Runtime
entries.doc:
`runtime` maven-like dependency scope.
Includes the dependencies that must be present in the runtime classpath.

entries.name: Compile
entries.doc:
`compile` maven-like dependency scope.
Includes the dependencies that must be present in the compilation classpath.

Does not include the module compilation results for [local dependencies][Dependency.Local].

classes.name: org.jetbrains.amper.plugins/Classpath

properties.name: dependencies
properties.doc:
Dependencies to resolve.
Version conflict resolution may apply if necessary for the given list of dependencies.

properties.name: scope
properties.doc: Resolution scope to use to resolve [dependencies].

classes.doc:
Use to get a resolved JVM classpath for the list of [dependencies].

The resulting classpath can be obtained via [resolvedFiles] property.

To conveniently get the classpath of the *current module* the plugin is applied to,
you can reference the provided values:
- `${module.runtimeClasspath}`
- `${module.compileClasspath}`

classes.name: org.jetbrains.amper.plugins/CompilationArtifact

properties.name: from
properties.doc: The local module to get the compilation result from.

properties.name: artifact
properties.doc:
Path to the compilation artifact.
It's a JAR for JVM.

classes.doc:
Provides the compilation result of the [given][from] module.

Warning: only JVM platform is currently supported.

classes.name: org.jetbrains.amper.plugins/Dependency/Local

properties.name: modulePath
properties.doc:
Path to the module root directory.

Must start with the `"."` symbol in YAML, e.g. `"../module-name"`, or `"."`.
Just `"module-name"` is treated like an external [Maven] dependency.

classes.doc: A dependency on a local module in the project.

classes.name: org.jetbrains.amper.plugins/ModuleSources

properties.name: from
properties.doc: Module to get source directories for.

properties.name: kind
properties.doc: What kind of sources to request.

properties.name: includeGenerated
properties.doc:
`false` if only user sources are to be included with respect to the project layout.
`true` if sources generated by other tasks (plugins, KSP, etc.) are also to be included.

properties.name: sourceDirectories
properties.doc:
Resulting source directories for the [module][from].
Not all of them may exist.

classes.doc:
Use to get module [source directories][sourceDirectories] from the module.
Takes the source layout option into account.

Use [kind] to get different kinds of module sources.

Currently, only JVM non-test sources are supported.
